Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: To deliver, through excellent leadership and engagement with CPS staff and partners in the Criminal Justice System, the highest quality, most efficient and effective prosecution service within their Area, across all legal advice, legal decisions, advocacy, business and staff management.  To promote CPS’ core values and the equality and diversity agenda, ensuring there are effective internal and external communications strategies in place.  They will work collaboratively and collegiately in their Area to deliver improvements in local and the wider Area performance, ensuring consistent and clear high quality representation of CPS across the wide range of the Area’s responsibilities and relationships.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: The job holder will lead on delivering and maximising efficiencies through digital working and will also serve as the principal liaison with Her Majesty’s Courts and Tribunals Service (HMCTS) joint project on developing a common CPS/HMCTS IT (Information Technology) platform. They will provide strategic direction and leadership across the CPS and in partnership with HMCTS, to develop a sustainable cost effective and efficient solution to meet the information management and business process needs of both agencies.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: The Principal Legal Advisor reports directly to the DPP providing advice and assistance on the most complex, sensitive and high profile casework and assurance on legal standards across the CPS.  This includes provision of strategic direction, setting case strategies, dealing with complex disclosure matters, media handling and trial strategies, working with and directing the reviewing prosecutor/Counsel.  As the Head of Profession for the organisation (besides the DPP) they also lead a group of CPS advocates and conduct certain appellate advocacy on behalf of the service.

Name: Alison Saunders
Job/Team Function: The Director of Public Prosecutions (DPP) is the national head of service for the Crown Prosecution Service for England and Wales, appointed by and responsible to the Attorney General.  It is the function of the DPP with a view to initiation or continuation of criminal proceedings, to consider the facts and information brought to their notice by police or others, and where they think proper, to initiate, undertake and carry on criminal proceedings.

Name: Peter Lewis
Job/Team Function: The Chief Executive is responsible for running the organisation on a day-to-day basis and to implement the strategic goals and objectives of the CPS.  Working closely with the DPP, they enable the CPS Board to fulfil its governance function. They are also responsible for overseeing human resource management, financial issues, community and public relations.  They provide direction and leadership towards the achievement of the CPS’ philosophy, mission statement, strategy and its annual goals and objectives.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: The Chief Operating Officer leads in the performance management of Chief Crown Prosecutors, ensuring the areas within their remit are delivering an effective, victim and justice focused prosecution service to their communities in line with CPS’ strategy and wider criminal justice prerogatives. Responsible for the performance management of the headquarters casework divisions, ensuring delivery of a high quality prosecution service for the most high profile, complex and nationally driven cases. They report to the DPP and Chief Executive on performance across the country, drawing out thematic and geographical issues and ensuring standards are raised and maintained across the organisation.
